title: What are the best philosophy podcasts for learning? - Quora

response.answer_text: Philosophize This! For anyone interested in an educational podcast about philosophy where you don't need to be a graduate-level philosopher to understand it. In chronological order, the thinkers and ideas that forged the world we live in are broken down and explained. Philosophy Bites top philosophers interviewed on bite-sized topics The Public Philosopher Harvard political philosopher Michael Sandel examines the thinking behind a current controversy The Partially Examined Life Philosophy Podcast The Partially Examined Life is a philosophy podcast by some guys who were at one point set on doing philosophy for a living but then thought better of it. The Philosopher's Zone - Program podcast The Philosopher's Zone looks at the world of philosophy and at the world through philosophy. Philosophy 247 David Edmonds interviews leading philosophers about moral issues that effect us 24/7. Philosophy for our times The Institute of Art and Ideas is committed to placing philosophy and big ideas at the heart of public life -- building philosophy for our times. Patterson in Pursuit: Philosophy | Politics | Religion Interviews with intellectuals from across the globe. Topics include philosophy, religion, science, politics, economics, and everything else that's important to humans. — You can find more from https://www.listennotes.com/best-podcasts/126/philosophy-podcasts/

Donnie Haflich has left a few good ones. One which is missing, in my opinion, is BBC’s In Our Time, hosted by Melvyn Bragg. Its episodes discuss the key ideas and key thinkers in the domains of philosophy, history, science, culture, and religion. Each episode is carefully directed by Bragg to ensure his guests (who are usually professors in the relevant subject) don’t go off on tangents or lose the viewer’s interest; no programme is more than 45 minutes. For that reason I find In Our Time to have more serious, enjoyable, and informative discussions than Partially Examined Life (although I still really enjoy the latter).
